TopicTitle: Vehicle assembly facility bug windows 64 bits

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone, i've bought the game since few days and it's awesome, i have started the career mode and i got 210 000 $ to upgrade my facility to build larger spacecraft.

But i have a big problem which don't let me continue my career:

level 2 vehicle assembly facility but:

- max craft parts: 255

- max craft mass: 18 t

There is a probleme with max craft mass.

 I found on the forum that is "normal" with window 64 bits version, but i can't play on window 32 bits because i need to use more than 4 GB ram.

Will you fix this bug soon ?

Edit: I didn't have any crash or freeze (like some win 64 bits users) since i play KSP .

You need to upgrade your launchpad, but you won't really be able to in the 64bit version as it's buggy.

You can try editing the persistent.sfs file in your saves folder to set the launchpad level, but really it's recommended to use the normal KSP.exe

If you're struggling with RAM I recommend the Active Texture Management addon ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Oh .... i haven't seen i can upgrade launchpad

I will try it, thanks !

Edit: Is there graphic bug on win 64 like no cloud in the sky ?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-24T11:59:21Z" title="02/24/2015 11:59  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 24, 2015</time> by F1R3B477**

That's not a bug. KSP doesn't have clouds in the stock game yet. There are some mods which will add those effects, along with many others. The only one I know of off the top of my head is Environment Visual Enhancements, or EVE for short. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Nice i've install astronomer visual pack (and 5 required mods like EVE), i launch ksp in 64 bits mode, game run perfectly and its beautifull without crash or freeze (only little delay when i load something like a big craft) but it use 6 to 9 GB of ram ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif). thanks for help
